author: gakonst
content: Hi! Just caught up with this chat. Are there any perf numbers on history sync time I could peek at? Tysm!

author: pipermerriam
content:
I don't have hard numbers.  Joshey and Alexey from reth did some experiments embedding trin in reth for syncing pre-merge.  From memory, the results were around an order of magnitude slower than what you guys current get over DevP2P which matches roughly with our expectations for this experiment. 

We don't believe these results are representative of the throughput that can be expected to be possible from Portal for two main reasons.  Trin currently has a performance bottleneck that hasn't been identitifed which is preventing us from coming even close to saturating our network pipe.  Fluffy (The Nim client) has demonstrated much faster sync speeds in some of their historical tests of this functionality.

author: pipermerriam
content: I suspect that the DevP2P approach of pulling from a single source will likely always be able to win in an all-out-speed competition, but there's no technical reason or limitation why Portal can't achieve numbers that are reasonably close in terms of speed.  Fluffy's historical tests suggest it should be trivial for Portal to serve block history at a speed faster than block processing speed which is ultimately the bottleneck for full history sync.
